snippet: Adolfo Carrión Jr., a former Bronx borough president who currently has no party affiliation, is seeking Republican and Independence Party backing, an adviser said.
abstract: Adolfo Carrion Jr, former Bronx borough president and Obama administration official, is all but certain to jump into New York City's 2013 mayoral race, not as a Democrat, but as an independent seeking the Republican nomination; should he prevail in a Republican primary, he could pose a credible challenge to whoever emerges from what is expected to be a wide-open and bruising primary for the Democratic nomination.
lead_paragraph: Adolfo Carrión Jr., a former Bronx borough president who currently has no party affiliation, is seeking Republican and Independence Party backing, an adviser said.

headline.seo: Adolfo Carrión Jr. Quits Democrats; Mayoral Bid Likely
headline.main: Likely Mayoral Hopeful Leaves Democratic Party
headline.print_headline: Likely Mayoral Hopeful Leaves Democratic Party
